column5: I have a very minor scratch on the yammy but hoping to find a tube or touch up to cover up. Believe Yamaha only makes a spray can version now?? Don't want to go that route so looking for options for a match of something else that would work with the dark metallic silver in a tube and brush version similar to automotive stuff.  Anyone been through this?  Thanks
Have you tried buffing compound? if it,s minor,Im sure it would buff out/blend.
Thanks but it will require some paint by the looks of it.
Spray can is all I could find, I apply it with a small brush on scratches.
If you can fine the paint in a rattle spray can; spray the amount you need into a small container and have at it with your brush.  Dan.

An old touch up paint trick is to spray a small amount of paint into the can's cap. Then tear off a paper match and use the torn off end as your paint brush. You're done without any clean up required and it works great to boot.
Thanks all I'll see if I can track down the spray instead and use a brush
